title: WHIRLING F3 / CLEAR WINDOW VISCAL DIFFICULT
description: This window has been recently replaced. High perception to notice. This dialogue gets a viscal and becomes trivial once someone admits Assassination

dialogueTree.title: Visual Calculus: "You see the same two neon lit shape..."
dialogueTree.text: You see the same two neon lit shapes -- a man and a woman. Only now a red thread bisects the room, pointing from the antenna outside, to the cupboard on the wall.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is ballistics. She's left a t..."
links.text: "This is ballistics. She's left a trajectory for us..." The lieutenant tests the thread with his finger. Drawn taut, it rebounds instantly.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "A ray of backward motion explodes f..."
links.text: A ray of backward motion explodes from the man's mouth: through the window, to the roof outside, widening into a radius -- A prime.

links.title: Cuno: ""Oh, oh!" The kid gets excited. "Cu..."
links.text: "Oh, oh!" The kid gets excited. "Cuno knows this shit -- ballistics shit, Science Radio shit. Shows where the shot came from."

links.title: Logic: "This is amateur ballistics. She lef..."
links.text: This is amateur ballistics. She left a trajectory for you...

dialogueTree.title: Visual Calculus: "You see the same two neon lit shape..."
dialogueTree.text: You see the same two neon lit shapes -- a man and a woman. Only now a red thread bisects the room, pointing from the antenna outside, to the cupboard on the wall.

dialogueTree.title: Visual Calculus: "The same two neon lit shapes -- a m..."
dialogueTree.text: The same two neon lit shapes -- a man and a woman. A ray of backward motion explodes from the man's mouth, through the window, to the roof outside, widening into a radius -- A prime.

links.title: You: "I extrapolated all the points of or..."
links.text: I extrapolated all the points of origin. Now, where does the thread lead?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It suggests the bullet came from th..."
links.text: It suggests the bullet came from the extreme upper quadrant of possible angles -- from a point beyond the roof: B'''.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The island in the bay."
links.text: The island in the bay.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The island in the bay."
links.text: The island in the bay.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Maybe if you extrapolate all possib..."
links.text: Maybe if you extrapolate all possible points of origin first, the thread will make sense?

links.title: You: "Where does the thread lead?"
links.text: Where does the thread lead?

links.title: You: "What *is* the point of origin, damn..."
links.text: What *is* the point of origin, damn it!?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's not the roof -- and you would..."
links.text: It's not the roof -- and you would have found it had it been on the coast, in either B prime or B double prime, which leaves...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The island in the bay."
links.text: The island in the bay.

links.title: You: ""Is she trying to tell us the shot..."
links.text: "Is she trying to tell us the shot came from the islet?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Unless she thinks the perpetrator..."
links.text: "Unless she thinks the perpetrator was standing *on* the ring antenna, that is where the thread seems to point." He nods.

links.title: You: ""I think the shot might have come f..."
links.text: "I think the shot might have come from the islet."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not impossible." He nods. "Th..."
links.text: "It's not impossible." He nods. "There is a narrow opening between the commercial area and the collapsed tenement north of it..."

links.title: You: ""There are *ruins* on that islet. A..."
links.text: "There are *ruins* on that islet. A sunken seafort. I saw it through the coin operated viewer."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I remember." He looks out the wind..."
links.text: "I remember." He looks out the window and onto the bay.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks out the window..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks out the window and onto the bay.

links.title: You: ""How did she know how to do this?""
links.text: "How did she know how to do this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She was there that night -- she wo..."
links.text: "She was there that night -- she would have known precisely where the bullet hole was in the glass..."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "She had a long time to think about..."
links.text: She had a long time to think about it after. Standing on that roof -- staring at the glass...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It also looks like there may be mo..."
links.text: "It also looks like there may be more to her skill set than we know. The question is -- should we trust her?"

links.title: You: ""Of course we don't *trust* her.""
links.text: "Of course we don't *trust* her."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know. At this point..." He..."
links.text: "I don't know. At this point..." He stops mid-sentence.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "...what difference does it make?"
links.text: ...what difference does it make?

links.title: You: ""This is her way of saying she's so..."
links.text: "This is her way of saying she's sorry."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I find that hard to believe. But a..."
links.text: "I find that hard to believe. But at this point... what difference does it make?"

links.title: You: ""I just don't know.""
links.text: "I just don't know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed. Neither do I.""
links.text: "Indeed. Neither do I."

links.title: Authority: "He's used to knowing who to trust...."
links.text: He's used to knowing who to trust. This makes him uncomfortable.

links.title: You: ""This is also the only point of ori..."
links.text: "This is also the only point of origin we haven't ruled out yet." (Proceed.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So it is.""
links.text: "So it is."

links.title: Empathy: "For a second he seems... tired."
links.text: For a second he seems... tired.

links.title: You: ""You seem unenthusiastic.""
links.text: "You seem unenthusiastic."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I just haven't gotten a lot of sle..."
links.text: "I just haven't gotten a lot of sleep these past few days."

links.title: Empathy: "He doesn't *really* believe this wi..."
links.text: He doesn't *really* believe this will yield anything.

links.title: You: ""Maybe we need to go to the island?""
links.text: "Maybe we need to go to the island?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs, looking into..."
links.text: The lieutenant sighs, looking into the cold distance across the water...

links.title: Suggestion: "He is trying to justify it to himse..."
links.text: He is trying to justify it to himself.

links.title: Logic: "The lead is flimsy. You might as we..."
links.text: The lead is flimsy. You might as well go around Martinaise looking under every rock and talking to every person -- but *what else is there*?

links.title: Half Light: "He sees danger. Another trap perhap..."
links.text: He sees danger. Another trap perhaps? He must be cautious for a reason -- this man has decades of experience.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There, across the grey water -- ami..."
links.text: There, across the grey water -- amidst crumbling concrete, a birch tree... and the half-sunken ruins of a flak tower.

links.title: You: ""I don't have anything to say. This..."
links.text: "I don't have anything to say. This is just something we have to do, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I understand.""
links.text: "I understand."

links.title: Endurance: "He will. He has it in him."
links.text: He will. He has it in him.

links.title: You: ""What else is there?""
links.text: "What else is there?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not a lot, no.""
links.text: "Not a lot, no."

links.title: You: ""You're not... afraid, are you?""
links.text: "You're not... afraid, are you?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. I just don't want to walk into..."
links.text: "No. I just don't want to walk into another *embarrassment*. I am a creature of pride, you see..." There is silence. "I'm afraid of becoming a joke."

links.title: Volition: "It's not something he's proud of, b..."
links.text: It's not something he's proud of, but that's the way it is.

links.title: You: ""I remember an anti-aircraft gun. O..."
links.text: "I remember an anti-aircraft gun. Or the ruins of one... on the island. From the coin operated viewer."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could be the makings of a sniper's..."
links.text: "Could be the makings of a sniper's nest..." He nods.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Why not? Military fortifications ar..."
links.text: Why not? Military fortifications are made for that kind of thing.

links.title: You: ""Kim, let's go to the fucking islan..."
links.text: "Kim, let's go to the fucking island." (Go!)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, let's go to the fucking isla..."
links.text: "Okay, let's go to the fucking island." He takes a second to gather himself, then says...

links.title: You: ""I'm going to the island  -- are yo..."
links.text: "I'm going to the island  -- are you in?" (Go.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course." He nods. "Of course I'..."
links.text: "Of course." He nods. "Of course I'm in." He takes a second to gather himself, then says...

links.title: You: ""Actually, yeah. Let's not go to th..."
links.text: "Actually, yeah. Let's not go to the island." (No go.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. You're right. We have to go to..."
links.text: "No. You're right. We have to go to the island. Pardon me, the concussion..." He takes a second to gather himself, then says...

links.title: You: ""Yeah, that's not gonna work. There..."
links.text: "Yeah, that's not gonna work. There must be something else we've missed."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. There's nothing else..." He si..."
links.text: "No. There's nothing else..." He sighs, looking into the cold distance across the water.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How do we get there? Joyce Messier..."
links.text: "How do we get there? Joyce Messier had her sloop, but she's gone."

links.title: You: ""Lilienne, the Net Picker. She's ta..."
links.text: "Lilienne, the Net Picker. She's tarring her boat..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah... Yes, of course. The village...."
links.text: "Ah... Yes, of course. The village. Let's go."

links.title: You: ""Maybe someone in the fishing villa..."
links.text: "Maybe someone in the fishing village can help? The clump of houses on the coast?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe -- there were boats there. W..."
links.text: "Maybe -- there were boats there. We should ask around. Let's go."

links.title: You: ""I have no idea. Don't we have... a..."
links.text: "I have no idea. Don't we have... a boat?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, but it'll take them days to g..."
links.text: "Yes, but it'll take them days to give it to us."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We could ask around in the fishing..."
links.text: "We could ask around in the fishing village. They had boats."

links.title: You: ""This is also a location we have ye..."
links.text: "This is also a location we have yet to rule out." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""This is also a location we have ye..."
links.text: "This is also a location we have yet to rule out." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""This is also one of the few places..."
links.text: "This is also one of the few places in Martinaise we haven't been to." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""Is Klaasje trying to tell us the s..."
links.text: "Is Klaasje trying to tell us the shot came from the islet?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Pig..." The kid looks at you with..."
links.text: "Pig..." The kid looks at you with something akin to admiration. "You're really fucking on to something there."

links.title: You: ""Cuno. I think the shot might have..."
links.text: "Cuno. I think the shot might have come from the islet."

links.title: Cuno: ""Islet? Like a gimp-island?" He thi..."
links.text: "Islet? Like a gimp-island?" He thinks. "I think you're on to something. The shot could've come from there..."

links.title: You: ""There are ruins on that islet. A s..."
links.text: "There are ruins on that islet. A sunken seafort. I saw it in the coin operated viewer."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah, Cuno's seen that shit. Crazy..."
links.text: "Yeah, Cuno's seen that shit. Crazy shit. Ain't nothing to Cuno, but lots of places to hide there."

links.title: You: ""How did she know how to do this?""
links.text: "How did she know how to do this?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Cuno's got no fucking clue." He lo..."
links.text: "Cuno's got no fucking clue." He looks at you. "You need to pig this shit. Cop-style."

links.title: You: ""This is also the only point of ori..."
links.text: "This is also the only point of origin I haven't ruled out yet." (Proceed.)

links.title: Cuno: ""Cool shit, sub-zero shit. Cuno's l..."
links.text: "Cool shit, sub-zero shit. Cuno's listening. You got his attention." A nod of approval, then: "So what's next?"

links.title: You: ""Looks like we need to go to the is..."
links.text: "Looks like we need to go to the island."

links.title: Cuno: "The boy squints, looking into the c..."
links.text: The boy squints, looking into the cold distance across the water...

links.title: Logic: "The lead is flimsy. You might as we..."
links.text: The lead is flimsy. You might as well go around Martinaise looking under every rock and talking to every person -- but *what else is there*?

links.title: Half Light: "He senses danger. Possibly a trap?..."
links.text: He senses danger. Possibly a trap? You shouldn't ignore this -- the kid's got serious street smarts.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There, across the grey water -- ami..."
links.text: There, across the grey water -- amidst crumbling concrete, a birch tree... the ruins of a flak tower, remember?

links.title: You: ""What else is there?""
links.text: "What else is there?"

links.title: Cuno: ""To do, you mean? Nothing. Harbour'..."
links.text: "To do, you mean? Nothing. Harbour's closed, everyone's dead. This scene is dead, pig."

links.title: You: ""You're not... afraid, are you?""
links.text: "You're not... afraid, are you?"

links.title: Cuno: ""The island?" He scoffs. "Cuno ain'..."
links.text: "The island?" He scoffs. "Cuno ain't afraid of fucking *anything*, pig."

links.title: You: ""I remember an anti-aircraft gun. T..."
links.text: "I remember an anti-aircraft gun. The ruins of one... on the island."

links.title: Cuno: ""Totally what a sniper would use."..."
links.text: "Totally what a sniper would use." He squints. "Aircraft gun."

links.title: You: ""Cuno, let's go to the fucking isla..."
links.text: "Cuno, let's go to the fucking island."

links.title: Cuno: ""Yeah, why fucking not?" He spits o..."
links.text: "Yeah, why fucking not?" He spits on the floor. "Just one question, though --"

links.title: You: ""I'm going to the island  -- are yo..."
links.text: "I'm going to the island  -- are you in?"

links.title: Cuno: ""Fuck yeah I'm in." He spits on the..."
links.text: "Fuck yeah I'm in." He spits on the floor.

links.title: You: ""Actually, yeah. Let's not go to th..."
links.text: "Actually, yeah. Let's not go to the island."

links.title: Cuno: ""Aw, fuck, pig. We totally gotta go..."
links.text: "Aw, fuck, pig. We totally gotta go to the island now." He pumps a fist in the air. "Tryna not go to the island... Just one Q."

links.title: You: ""It won't work. There must be somet..."
links.text: "It won't work. There must be something else I missed."

links.title: Cuno: ""Won't work? Sounds like you're avo..."
links.text: "Won't work? Sounds like you're avoidin' the truth, pig..." He looks out across the water.

links.title: Cuno: ""How are you gonna *get* to the isl..."
links.text: "How are you gonna *get* to the island? Cuno has his ways, but that ain't for your fat old ass."

links.title: You: ""Lilienne, the Net Picker in the vi..."
links.text: "Lilienne, the Net Picker in the village. She's tarring her boat..."

links.title: Cuno: ""Oh..." The boy's eyes dart back an..."
links.text: "Oh..." The boy's eyes dart back and forth. "The village on the coast. Yeah, you do that."

links.title: You: ""Maybe someone in the fishing villa..."
links.text: "Maybe someone in the fishing village can help?"

links.title: Cuno: ""There's this lady in the village....."
links.text: "There's this lady in the village... she..." He pauses, then mumbles: "Uh, yeah, there are boats there... You go. Do shit there, you'll get one. On the coast."

links.title: You: ""I have no idea. Don't we have... a..."
links.text: "I have no idea. Don't we have... a boat?"

links.title: You: ""This is also a location we have ye..."
links.text: "This is also a location we have yet to rule out." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""This is also a location I have yet..."
links.text: "This is also a location I have yet to rule out." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""This is also one of the few places..."
links.text: "This is also one of the few places in Martinaise I haven't been to." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: "Is she trying to tell me the shot c..."
links.text: Is she trying to tell me the shot came from the islet?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Obviously."
links.text: Obviously.

links.title: You: ""Wait -- I think the shot came from..."
links.text: "Wait -- I think the shot came from the *island*?"

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Islet, technically. But yes. It loo..."
links.text: Islet, technically. But yes. It looks more and more probable.

links.title: You: ""There are ruins on that islet. A s..."
links.text: "There are ruins on that islet. A sunken seafort. I saw it through the coin operated viewer."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Your voice sounds hollow in the des..."
links.text: Your voice sounds hollow in the deserted room... you are alone.

links.title: You: "How did she know how to do this?"
links.text: How did she know how to do this?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "She was there that night -- she wou..."
links.text: She was there that night -- she would have known precisely where the bullet hole was in the glass.

links.title: You: "This is also the only point of orig..."
links.text: This is also the only point of origin I haven't ruled out yet... (Proceed.)

links.title: Visual Calculus: "A powerful gust of wind coming in f..."
links.text: A powerful gust of wind coming in from the bay rattles the windowpane.

links.title: Logic: "The lead is flimsy, but *what else..."
links.text: The lead is flimsy, but *what else is there*? The alternative is going around Martinaise looking under every rock and talking to every person.

links.title: Half Light: "Danger? Another trap?"
links.text: Danger? Another trap?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There, across the grey water -- amo..."
links.text: There, across the grey water -- among crumbling concrete, a birch tree... the ruins of a flak tower, remember?

links.title: You: "What else is there?"
links.text: What else is there?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Nothing."
links.text: Nothing.

links.title: You: "I'm not afraid."
links.text: I'm not afraid.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Nothing scares you now."
links.text: Nothing scares you now.

links.title: You: "I remember an anti-aircraft gun. Th..."
links.text: I remember an anti-aircraft gun. The ruins of one... on the island.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The makings of a sniper's nest."
links.text: The makings of a sniper's nest.

links.title: You: ""Time to go to the fucking island.""
links.text: "Time to go to the fucking island."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It is. The fucking island awaits."
links.text: It is. The fucking island awaits.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "But how will you get to the island?"
links.text: But how will you get to the island?

links.title: You: "Lilienne, the Net Picker. She's tar..."
links.text: Lilienne, the Net Picker. She's tarring her boat...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Of course. The village on the coast..."
links.text: Of course. The village on the coast. Let's go.

links.title: You: "Maybe someone in the fishing villag..."
links.text: Maybe someone in the fishing village can help?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There were boats there. You should..."
links.text: There were boats there. You should ask around.

links.title: You: "I have no idea. Don't we have... a..."
links.text: I have no idea. Don't we have... a boat?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There were skiffs in the fishing vi..."
links.text: There were skiffs in the fishing village. You should ask around.

links.title: You: ""I'm going to the island.""
links.text: "I'm going to the island."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Of course. It's where the threads a..."
links.text: Of course. It's where the threads all meet...

links.title: You: "Actually, I don't want to go to the..."
links.text: Actually, I don't want to go to the island.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You have to go to the island. It's..."
links.text: You have to go to the island. It's where the threads all meet...

links.title: You: "This is also a location I have yet..."
links.text: This is also a location I have yet to rule out... (Proceed.)

links.title: You: "This is also a location I have yet..."
links.text: This is also a location I have yet to rule out... (Proceed.)

links.title: You: "This is also one of the few places..."
links.text: This is also one of the few places in Martinaise I have not been to... (Proceed.)

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The island in the bay."
links.text: The island in the bay.

links.title: You: "Inspect the ghostly figures."
links.text: Inspect the ghostly figures.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The man does not know the bullet ha..."
links.text: The man does not know the bullet has entered his brain. He never will. Death comes faster than the realization.

links.title: You: "Have a look at point A' -- the roof..."
links.text: Have a look at point A' -- the roof.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Ruby ruled this out vehemently. The..."
links.text: Ruby ruled this out vehemently. The shot would have been heard from downstairs -- where no one heard it. The likelihood of A' has fallen drastically. You may be looking for a sniper.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The shot had to come from a greater..."
links.text: The shot had to come from a greater distance -- beyond A'. Should we extrapolate to include *every* possible point of origin in Martinaise?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The ray cast from the man's mouth u..."
links.text: The ray cast from the man's mouth unravels into a fan of possible directions, all on the roof at first. The shot could have come from any of them. This is composite location A prime -- most likely of the origin points.

links.title: You: "Shouldn't there be gun residue outs..."
links.text: Shouldn't there be gun residue outside?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There could've been. Then the rain..."
links.text: There could've been. Then the rain and slush and wind washed it away. This was more than a week ago.

links.title: You: "So I'm what... 80% sure the roof is..."
links.text: So I'm what... 80% sure the roof is where the shot was made from?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "72%. With an antique weapon that fi..."
links.text: 72%. With an antique weapon that fires military-grade ammunition -- a Belle-Magrave rifle, for example. This is a good short distance, but not too short. The perpetrator aimed with their back against the railing, or possibly kneeling for precision. This would explain why it only took them one shot.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "72%. With a weapon that fires jacke..."
links.text: 72%. With a weapon that fires jacketed ammunition -- likely a rifle. This is a good short distance, but not too short. The perpetrator aimed with their back against the railing, or possibly kneeling for precision. This would explain why it only took them one shot.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "72%. With a weapon that's good for..."
links.text: 72%. With a weapon that's good for medium range, like a rifle or sports pistol. This is a good short distance, but not too short. The perpetrator aimed with their back against the railing, or possibly kneeling for precision. This would explain why it only took them one shot.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The lights were on in here. Outside..."
links.text: The lights were on in here. Outside it was dark. It was like shooting fish in an aquarium -- a well lit aquarium. The victim opened his mouth to let the bullet in. Neither of them would have seen anything outside, in the darkness -- too busy with their own bodies.

links.title: You: "Could the shot have come from *insi..."
links.text: Could the shot have come from *inside* the room? A closer point...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Point X would contradict the woman'..."
links.text: Point X would contradict the woman's testimony, rendering the entire proposition void. These figures would be wiped out, detective.

links.title: You: "Are there any arguments against A p..."
links.text: Are there any arguments against A prime, the roof?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "None that you've found thus far. Bu..."
links.text: None that you've found thus far. But that doesn't mean there aren't any.

links.title: You: "Could there have been another point..."
links.text: Could there have been another point of origin -- further away? (Conclude.)

links.title: Visual Calculus: "That's a 28%, yes. In this model th..."
links.text: That's a 28%, yes. In this model the shot *could* have come from a greater distance. Nothing excludes the possibility. Should we extrapolate to include *every* possible point of origin in Martinaise?

links.title: You: "I have the map -- extrapolate the r..."
links.text: I have the map -- extrapolate the radius to include all of Martinaise.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "According to your map of the distri..."
links.text: According to your map of the district, this shot could have come from a wide angle of locations -- starting with the northern edge of the abandoned boardwalk, ending with an islet in the bay. Let's call them B prime.

links.title: You: "More precisely?"
links.text: More precisely?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "B' for boardwalk; B'' for Land's En..."
links.text: B' for boardwalk; B'' for Land's End and B''' for the islet, detective. There may be smaller points in between, but those are too fine to zoom in on.

links.title: You: "Extrapolate the radius to include a..."
links.text: Extrapolate the radius to include all of Martinaise.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "According to your map of the distri..."
links.text: According to your map of the district, this shot could have come from a wide angle of locations -- starting with the northern edge of the abandoned boardwalk, ending with an islet in the bay. Let's call them B prime.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You would need a map for that -- a..."
links.text: You would need a map for that -- a map of Martinaise.

links.title: You: ""There was a map on sale in the boo..."
links.text: "There was a map on sale in the bookstore, wasn't there? A map of Martinaise? We need one."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant leans closer. "You'r..."
links.text: The lieutenant leans closer. "You're thinking -- what if the shot didn't come from the roof?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There was a map in the bookstore...."
links.text: "There was a map in the bookstore. We should come back with it, compare the landscape to the radius of the shot."

links.title: You: ""Never mind, I don't know what I'm..."
links.text: "Never mind, I don't know what I'm thinking here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No-no. We're onto something... The..."
links.text: "No-no. We're onto something... There was a map in the bookstore. We should come back with it, compare the landscape to the radius of the shot."

links.title: Cuno: ""Does Cuno look like a fucking bino..."
links.text: "Does Cuno look like a fucking bino to you? Cuno doesn't know this shit. Fucking book-shit." He seems unpleased with his lack of knowledge.

links.title: You: ""Hey, where do I get a map of Marti..."
links.text: "Hey, where do I get a map of Martinaise?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The bookstore. They have maps." Th..."
links.text: "The bookstore. They have maps." The lieutenant leans closer. "You're thinking what if the shot didn't come from the roof, right?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. We should come back with the..."
links.text: "Good. We should come back with the map and compare the landscape to the radius of the shot."

links.title: You: ""Never mind, I don't know what I'm..."
links.text: "Never mind, I don't know what I'm thinking here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No-no. We're onto something... We..."
links.text: "No-no. We're onto something... We should come back with a map and compare the landscape to the radius of the shot."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Your voice alone rings in the room...."
links.text: Your voice alone rings in the room. This visual forensics ability doesn't dispense shopping tips.

links.title: Logic: "In the bookstore!"
links.text: In the bookstore!

links.title: You: "Have a look at point B' -- the boar..."
links.text: Have a look at point B' -- the boardwalk.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Seven hundred metres away. The like..."
links.text: Seven hundred metres away. The likeliest of these B positions, 20% chance. A skilled sniper could have made the shot, provided he had a safe sniper's nest. Even with the light on inside, we're talking military training. At that distance the perpetrator would have had to take wind direction into account.

links.title: Logic: "This would explain why no one heard..."
links.text: This would explain why no one heard the gunshot -- the bullet came from far away.

links.title: You: "I've *sort of* ruled out this locat..."
links.text: I've *sort of* ruled out this location.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Indeed, there *was* a possible snip..."
links.text: Indeed, there *was* a possible sniper's nest underneath the boardwalk but no one had been there in months, if not years.

links.title: Logic: "It still remains an odd coincidence..."
links.text: It still remains an odd coincidence that there was a bunker there...

links.title: You: "Have a look at point B'' -- Land's..."
links.text: Have a look at point B'' -- Land's End.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "One-point-two kilometres away. The..."
links.text: One-point-two kilometres away. The least likely of these positions, let's say 3%. A truly skilled sniper could have done it, possibly from a tent? No... too far fetched.

links.title: You: "I have ruled out this location."
links.text: I have ruled out this location.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Indeed. There was no evidence of a..."
links.text: Indeed. There was no evidence of a sniper's nest in that location. The distance is too great and water vapour would have made the shot almost impossible.

links.title: You: "Have a look at point B''' -- the is..."
links.text: Have a look at point B''' -- the islet.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "One kilometre away. A point beyond..."
links.text: One kilometre away. A point beyond the docks, on an islet in the bay. The fort is ruined but the perpetrator may have found a stable spot on the beaches surrounding it, where the concrete crumbles into the sea -- as you saw in the coin operated viewer...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The shot would have been a small mi..."
links.text: The shot would have been a small miracle: 5% likelihood. There *is* an extremely narrow field of view from the bay to the window, between Rue de Saint Ghislaine 10 and 33A. The angle would have been extreme and access to the islets is questionable...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Then there's the thread the witness..."
links.text: Then there's the thread the witness left. She *did* have a first-hand view of the event. Perhaps she found something in the outer reaches of her memory of it...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "One kilometre away. An unlikely poi..."
links.text: One kilometre away. An unlikely point of origin, beyond the docks somewhere -- on an islet in the Bay of Martinaise perhaps? There *are* islets there, badly charted as they may be.

links.title: You: ""Kim, do you think the shot could h..."
links.text: "Kim, do you think the shot could have come from further than the roof? In Martinaise?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""From where, precisely?""
links.text: "From where, precisely?"

links.title: You: ""Let's say: B prime (the boardwalk)..."
links.text: "Let's say: B prime (the boardwalk); B double prime (Land's End); B triple prime (the islet)."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see you have given this a lot of..."
links.text: "I see you have given this a lot of thought," he remarks, raising an eyebrow. "Are those the locations you've singled out, in addition to the roof? And what is the likelihood, in your opinion, that it came from a further distance?"

links.title: You: ""It's *okay*.""
links.text: "It's *okay*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. Well, we should see if there..."
links.text: "Okay. Well, we should see if there is gunshot residue or sniper nests if we go down the coast. Rule these spots out -- one by one."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It would be the *diligent* thing t..."
links.text: "It would be the *diligent* thing to do. Until then -- personally -- I'm going with the roof version. A simple hypothesis can be wrong, but it's something to build on."

links.title: You: ""Much less than from the roof, but..."
links.text: "Much less than from the roof, but still."

links.title: You: ""I'm just being thorough.""
links.text: "I'm just being thorough."

links.title: You: ""Never mind.""
links.text: "Never mind."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: You: "So the shot could have come from so..."
links.text: So the shot could have come from somewhere further out than the roof...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It is possible that it came from B..."
links.text: It is possible that it came from B prime (the boardwalk), B double prime (Land's End), or B triple prime (the islet).

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You can't know for sure until you i..."
links.text: You can't know for sure until you investigate those locations.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant would probably agree..."
links.text: The lieutenant would probably agree that, in this situation, it's best to be thorough.

links.title: You: "Blink. [Leave.]"
links.text: Blink. [Leave.]

links.title: You: "Blink. [Leave.]"
links.text: Blink. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Visual Calculus: "The same two neon lit shapes -- a m..."
dialogueTree.text: The same two neon lit shapes -- a man and a woman. A ray of backward motion explodes from the man's mouth, through the window, to the roof outside, widening into a radius -- A prime.

dialogueTree.title: Clear Window: "Light from the desk lamp reflects o..."
dialogueTree.text: Light from the desk lamp reflects off the glass in an untarnished golden halo. The glass is pristine and utterly silent.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We need to do ballistics on this -..."
links.text: "We need to do ballistics on this -- understand where the shot came from once and for all."

links.title: Cuno: ""Shit I know this..." His voice is..."
links.text: "Shit I know this..." His voice is excited as he nods approvingly. "Cuno gets this shit. Ballistics shit, science shit."

links.title: Logic: "You need to understand where that s..."
links.text: You need to understand where that shot came from -- once and for all.

dialogueTree.title: Clear Window: "This window is pristine, at least o..."
dialogueTree.text: This window is pristine, at least on the inside. A red thread has been taped to the glass using adhesive tape. It trembles ever so slightly in the cold wind.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is ballistics. She's left a t..."
links.text: "This is ballistics. She's left a trajectory for us..." The lieutenant tests the thread with his finger. Drawn taut, it rebounds instantly.

links.title: Cuno: ""Oh, oh!" The kid gets excited. "Cu..."
links.text: "Oh, oh!" The kid gets excited. "Cuno knows this shit -- ballistics shit, Science Radio shit. Shows where the shot came from."

links.title: Logic: "This is amateur ballistics. She lef..."
links.text: This is amateur ballistics. She left a trajectory for you...

dialogueTree.title: Clear Window: "This window is pristine on the insi..."
dialogueTree.text: This window is pristine on the inside -- unlike the one next to it. Light from the desk lamp reflects off the glass in an untarnished golden halo.

links.title: You: "Run your finger across the surface..."
links.text: Run your finger across the surface of the glass.

links.title: Clear Window: "The glass is cold from the air flow..."
links.text: The glass is cold from the air flowing in.

links.title: Clear Window: "Smooth as ice. There are spots of m..."
links.text: Smooth as ice. There are spots of mud and rain on the outside. Even smudges. But the surface of the window is clear from the inside. No chips, no hairline fractures.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Following your lead, the lieutenant..."
links.text: Following your lead, the lieutenant leans in closer to inspect the surface.

links.title: Cuno: "The boy breathes on the glass and w..."
links.text: The boy breathes on the glass and writes something on the fogged up surface, then wipes it all away with his sleeve.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "He wrote: *The Cunn*."
links.text: He wrote: *The Cunn*.

links.title: You: ""This window was recently replaced.""
links.text: "This window was recently replaced."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like it, yes." He adjusts hi..."
links.text: "Looks like it, yes." He adjusts his glasses.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You know which window has *not* bee..."
links.text: You know which window has *not* been recently replaced?

links.title: You: "The one I smashed in my room?"
links.text: The one I smashed in my room?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, that one. Cold wind is seeping..."
links.text: Yes, that one. Cold wind is seeping in right now -- just one floor below you, messing up your concentration here.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Stop distracting him, he has work t..."
links.text: Stop distracting him, he has work to do -- plus, if I recall, the window had been giving him shit ever since he got here.

links.title: You: "What is this, *guilt* now?"
links.text: What is this, *guilt* now?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Whatever it is, it's messing with y..."
links.text: Whatever it is, it's messing with your concentration.

links.title: You: "Didn't we establish that someone el..."
links.text: Didn't we establish that someone else did that?

links.title: Logic: "I was being sarcastic. It was estab..."
links.text: I was being sarcastic. It was established that *you* did it. Anyway.

links.title: Inland Empire: "I think it was established that *yo..."
links.text: I think it was established that *you* did it. Anyway.

links.title: You: "What happened here?"
links.text: What happened here?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The golden light melts away into th..."
links.text: The golden light melts away into the blue, glassy darkness of your mind. In it are two neon lit shapes: a man and a woman on the single bed.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A two-hearted spider."
links.text: A two-hearted spider.

links.title: You: "What position are they in?"
links.text: What position are they in?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The man is kneeling, the woman is o..."
links.text: The man is kneeling, the woman is on her back. It's the night of March 4th and a shot has just been fired.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The man looks directly at the woman..."
links.text: The man looks directly at the woman. The shot's possible directions converge in his mouth -- a ray cast from somewhere outside, entering his brain.

links.title: Endurance: "Ending him."
links.text: Ending him.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The red thread bisecting the room s..."
links.text: The red thread bisecting the room shows the trajectory of the bullet.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The red thread bisecting the room s..."
links.text: The red thread bisecting the room shows the trajectory of the bullet -- Klaasje has done some amateur ballistics here.

links.title: You: "Where does it come from?"
links.text: Where does it come from?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "From the roof outside -- location A..."
links.text: From the roof outside -- location A prime. The glass fractures around the bullet hole. Shards face inwards like a corona behind the woman's back...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The golden light melts away into th..."
links.text: The golden light melts away into the blue, glassy darkness of your mind. In it are two neon lit shapes: a man and a woman on the single bed.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "No. We're not failing this. You did..."
links.text: No. We're not failing this. You didn't get shot for nothing. Close your eyes and open them -- you can do this. You've done it before.

links.title: You: "Look around."
links.text: Look around.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The golden light melts away into th..."
links.text: The golden light melts away into the blue, glassy darkness of your mind. In it are two neon lit shapes: a man and a woman on the single bed.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The golden light melts away into th..."
links.text: The golden light melts away into the blue, glassy darkness of your mind. In it are two neon lit shapes: a man and a woman on the single bed.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You don't know when to quit, do you..."
links.text: You don't know when to quit, do you?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Again with this. You're not some ki..."
links.text: Again with this. You're not some kind of super-detective. Question people, bust a lip open. Leave this glass cathedral of ballistics to the smart boys.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "A vague sense of disappointment fil..."
links.text: A vague sense of disappointment fills you. The glass shimmers as if taunting you with its secrets.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You get the feeling this room would..."
links.text: You get the feeling this room would tell you something crucial if you only knew how to listen...

links.title: You: ""Tell me again Kim, what are we loo..."
links.text: "Tell me again Kim, what are we looking for here? Ballistics?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not exactly sure either, to be..."
links.text: "I'm not exactly sure either, to be honest. My imagination has a way of failing me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a weakness," he admits after..."
links.text: "It's a weakness," he admits after a pause, looking in the direction of the stairs.

links.title: You: ""This is bullshit. Bullshit window.""
links.text: "This is bullshit. Bullshit window."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is." The lieutenant touches the..."
links.text: "It is." The lieutenant touches the window. "We're beating our heads against this -- let's go do something more useful."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. On the contrary, this whole ro..."
links.text: "No. On the contrary, this whole room could be very useful if we could read it." He looks down the stairs. "Maybe later."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Clear Window: "The window stands mute in the frame..."
links.text: The window stands mute in the frame. The wind picks up outside.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
